intro: Eucalyptus medialis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mallee, is a species of eucalyptus native to southern Australia. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and smooth, often greyish bark. It produces small, globular flower buds that open to reveal white or pale pink flowers. Eucalyptus medialis is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands.
